sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &applet; was created to control the desktop by voice, bringing a great increase to the GNOME Desktop Environment. The objective of the &applet;is to bring an Desktop Environment efficient as possible for linux users, letting the usability more easy beyond bring a great advance on acessibility systems on Linux. Use of voice instead keyboard is more intuitive and more easy.

sect2.title: To Add &applet; to a Panel
sect2.para: To add &applet; to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose Add to Panel. Select &applet; in the Add to the panel dialog, then click OK.

sect1.title: How to use
sect1.para: The &applet; allows you to control desktop with voice.

sect2.title: Microphone
sect2.para: First of use &applet; you need to configure properly your microfone. Connect the microphone on the computer, test if it's working. If the microphone isn't working, go to sound properties and adjust the microphone. When the microphone be ready, go to the next topic.

sect2.title: Initializing the &applet;
sect2.para: To initialize the &applet; follow the steps.
Click on the Red symbol on panel and choose start control to make the software work every time or choose keypress control to make the software work only when a key is pressed.

caption.para: Shows the application on Idle State
Shows the application on Init and Calibrating States
Shows the application on Ready State

sect2.para: If you clicked on start control, when the symbol is green you can start to speech. If you clicked on start keypress control, first of start to speech you need to press a key.
When the software is processing the speech, the symbol become blue.

caption.para: Shows the application on Listening State

sect2.title: Using the &applet;
sect2.para:
The functions to control windows that we implented are:
RUN TERMINAL : Open gnome-terminal
RUN BROWSER : Open Epiphany
RUN MAIL : Open Evolution
RUN TEXT EDITOR : Open GEdit
CLOSE WINDOW
MAXIMIZE WINDOW
MINIMIZE WINDOW
NEXT WINDOW

We can control menus too, but you need to have C locale set. To control the menus you can try something like:
FILE .. OPEN
HELP .. ABOUT
SAVE
PRINT
UNDO
PASTE

You can control the mouse too. To control the mouse you can try something like:
CLICK
RIGHT CLICK
MOUSE UP
MOUSE DOWN
MOUSE RIGHT
MOUSE LEFT

sect1.title: Getting Help
sect1.para: If the voice control applet doesn't work for you, please try to contact developers.
First of all, please check that sound is actually recorded in your system. If no, try to adjust mixer settings.
The applet and SR is quite complex system in the development, so please don't expect much right now.
To report any bug you can send to festlang-gvc@lists.berlios.de. You need to be subscribed to send e-mails.
